div.head: Information on this customization
div.p: Schema for MAJLIS Project. This part of the schema is used for entering descriptions of the manuscript additions using XForms.
Built on the Beta maṣāḥǝft Guidelines contain examples and details of that customization.
Added Rules from the consolidated schema of FIRHIST
Constrained this schema for generating forms.

elementSpec.desc: Specify range of folios of a text within the manuscript.
A sequence of bullet points ("item") organized as a list.

Look up the place records. Try different spellings in different languages! If no suitable record exists, create a new one. The place given here refers to the acquisition (and not the production of the copy).
Use the lookup to search for the title of the work.
Any relevant additions found within a manuscript such as marginalia or other annotations. You can give a summary in the p element and describe specific additions inside list elements.
Transcribe relevant portion of the text. Specify language and script of the document. Alternatively, provide a translation of the relevant portion of the text.
Look up the person records in the database. Try different spellings in different languages! If no suitable record exists, create a new one. Add additional persons as required.

Specify the relationship between the person and another person or object. Choose the kind of relation from the list provided. Create and use fields for "Subject", "Object", and "Mutual" as indicated in the relation description. Additional "Mutual" fields can be created at your discretion.

elementSpec.desc: Use the lookup to reference entities that have a mutual relation.
Use the lookup to reference the subject in the relation.
Use the lookup to reference the object in the relation.
Describe the relation and pay attention to the Note and Transcription fields – the other fields are to be filled out if they are relevant to the relation.
Specify the shelfmark of a manuscript section.
Fill in the date in CE. The date refers to the acquisition (not the production of the copy).
Give a brief account of the relation you are describing, including the names of all the persons, places and objects involved.
